data.title: Scrambled alphabet
data.solution:
scrambled_alphabet = input()
scrambled_alphabet = ' ' + scrambled_alphabet

n = int(input())

words = list()

for _ in range(n):
    w = input()
    words.append(w)

max_length = max(map(len, words))

def word_key(w=str()) -> int:
    w += ' ' * (max_length - len(w))
    n = 0
    for l in w:
        i = scrambled_alphabet.index(l)
        n *= 100
        n += i
    return n

for w in sorted(words, key=lambda x: word_key(x)):
    print(w)
data.statement: Sort a list of words in lexicographic order based on the position of the characters in a scrambled alphabet.

data.constraints:
length of a scrambled alphabet = 26
[[w]] length ≤ 26
[[n]] ≤ 26
all letters are lowercase
data.stubGenerator:
read alphabet:word(26)
read n:int
loop n read w:word(26)
loop n write word
data.inputDescription:
<<First line>>: scrambled alphabet
<<Second line>>: number of words [[n]]
<<Next [[n]] lines>>: a word [[w]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Sort a list of words in lexicographic order based on the position of the characters in a scrambled alphabet.
Input
First line: scrambled alphabet
Second line: number of words n
Next n lines: a word w
Output
n lines: a word
Constraints
length of a scrambled alphabet = 26
w length ≤ 26
n ≤ 26
all letters are lowercase
Example
Input
ibcdefghajklmnopqrstuvwxyz
2
papa
papi
Output
papi
papa
